2009

  • One of the important goals of software engineering is to minimize the complexity of software development and maintenance
  • Generally, object oriented programming increases programmer productivity, quality of software, understandability of software, scalability of software, lifetime of software
  • Coupling is the degree to which each program module relies on each one of the other modules.
  • Cohesion is a measure of hos strongly-related and focused the various responsibilities of a software
  • It is desirable to maximize cohesion and minimize coupling
  • Const member function does not modify any data members of the object on which it is called
  • friend function of a class has the right to access the non-public members of the class
  • An abstract class should contain at least one abstract method
  • ?? can check whether two classes have inheritance relationship
  • What is encapsulation? ???
